inference:
The large square $ABCD$ has side length 5. The shaded region is the area of the large square minus the areas of the three smaller squares. The three smaller squares have side lengths 1, 1, and 3.
The area of the large square is $5^2 = 25$.
The area of the three smaller squares are $1^2 = 1$, $1^2 = 1$, and $3^2 = 9$.
The total area of the three smaller squares is $1+1+9=11$.
The area of the shaded region is $25 - 11 = 14$.
Final Answer: $\boxed{14}$
ground_truth:
The $\text L$-shaped region is made up of two rectangles with area $3\times 1=3$ plus the corner square with area $1\times 1=1,$ so the area of the $\text L$-shaped figure is $2\times 3+1=\boxed{7}.$

OR

$\text{Square }FECG-\text{Square }FHIJ=4\times 4-3\times 3 =16-9=\boxed{7}.$

OR

The $\text L$-shaped region can be decomposed into a $4\times 1$ rectangle and a $3\times 1$ rectangle. So the total area is $\boxed{7}.$
